summary.span: 表示提供快速、非快取、順向 (Forward-only) 存取 XML 資料的讀取器 (Reader)。

span.span: Represents a reader that provides fast, non-cached, forward-only access to XML data.

summary.span: 從 .NET Framework 2.0 開始，建議您改用 類別。

span.span: Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you use the class instead.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 提供的 XML 資料流的順向、 唯讀存取。 provides forward-only, read-only access to a stream of XML data. 所謂目前節點，是指讀取器定位所在的節點。The current node refers to the node on which the reader is positioned. 讀取器進階使用任何讀取的方法和屬性會反映目前節點的值。The reader is advanced using any of the read methods and properties reflect the value of the current node. 這個類別會實作且符合 W3C 可延伸標記語言 (XML) 1.0 和 XML recommendation 中的命名空間。This class implements and conforms to the W3C Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 and the Namespaces in XML recommendations. `XmlTextReader` 提供下列功能：`XmlTextReader` provides the following functionality: - 強制使用的格式正確的 XML。Enforces the rules of well-formed XML. - `XmlTextReader` 不提供資料驗證。`XmlTextReader` does not provide data validation. - 檢查`DocumentType`節點是語式正確。Checks that `DocumentType` nodes are well-formed. `XmlTextReader` 檢查 DTD 的格式正確性，但不會驗證使用 DTD。`XmlTextReader` checks the DTD for well-formedness, but does not validate using the DTD. - 節點位置是`XmlNodeType.EntityReference`，單一的空白`EntityReference`則會傳回節點 (也就是屬性是`String.Empty`)。For nodes where is `XmlNodeType.EntityReference`, a single empty `EntityReference` node is returned (that is, the property is `String.Empty`). > [!NOTE] > DTD 中的實體的實際宣告稱為`Entity`節點。The actual declarations of entities in the DTD are called `Entity` nodes. 當您在資料中參考這些節點時，它們就會呼叫`EntityReference`節點。When you refer to these nodes in your data, they are called `EntityReference` nodes. - 不會展開預設屬性。Does not expand default attributes. 因為`XmlTextReader`不會執行資料驗證所需的額外檢查它所提供的快速語式剖析器。Because the `XmlTextReader` does not perform the extra checks required for data validation, it provides a fast well-formedness parser. 若要執行資料驗證，請使用 驗證。To perform data validation, use a validating . 若要讀取 XML 資料從，使用。To read XML data from an , use . `XmlTextReader` 擲回xml 剖析錯誤。`XmlTextReader` throws an on XML parse errors. 擲回例外狀況之後讀取器的狀態不是可預測的。After an exception is thrown the state of the reader is not predictable. 例如，報告的節點類型可能不同於目前節點的實際節點類型。For example, the reported node type may be different than the actual node type of the current node. 使用屬性來檢查讀取器是否處於錯誤狀態。Use the property to check whether a reader is in error state. ## 安全性考量Security Considerations 以下是使用時的考慮事項類別。The following are things to consider when using the class. - 擲回例外狀況可以揭露您不想要的路徑資訊反昇至應用程式。Exceptions thrown the can disclose path information that you do not want bubbled up to the application. 應用程式必須捕捉例外狀況並予以適當處理。Your applications must catch exceptions and process them appropriately. - DTD 處理預設會啟用。DTD processing is enabled by default. 停用 DTD 處理，如果您擔心阻絕服務問題，或如果您正在處理不受信任的來源。Disable DTD processing if you are concerned about Denial of Service issues or if you are dealing with untrusted sources. 設定屬性停用 DTD 處理。Set the property to to disable DTD processing. 如果已啟用 DTD 處理，則可使用 限制 可存取的資源。If you have DTD processing enabled, you can use the to restrict the resources that the can access. 您還可以設計應用程式，讓 XML 處理具有記憶體和時間限制。You can also design your application so that the XML processing is memory and time constrained. 例如，在 ASP.NET 應用程式中設定逾時限制。For example, configure time-out limits in your ASP.NET application. - XML 資料可以包括外部資源，例如 DTD 檔案的參考。XML data can include references to external resources such as a DTD file. 依預設，外部資源會使用不具使用者認證的 物件來解析。By default external resources are resolved using an object with no user credentials. 您可以透過執行下列其中一項作業，進一步保護它：You can secure this further by doing one of the following: - 藉由將 屬性設為 物件，限制 可以存取的資源。Restrict the resources that the can access by setting the property to an object. - 藉由將 屬性設為 ，來禁止 `null` 開啟外部資源。Do not allow the to open any external resources by setting the property to `null`. - XML 資料可以包含需要相當長時間來處理的大量屬性、命名空間宣告、巢狀項目等。XML data can contain a large number of attributes, namespace declarations, nested elements and so on that require a substantial amount of time to process. 若要限制的輸入會傳送至大小、 建立自訂 IStream 實作，並提供。To limit the size of the input that is sent to the , create a custom IStream implementation and supply it the . - 方法可以用來處理資料的大量資料流。The method can be used to handle large streams of data. 此方法每次會讀取較少數量的字元，而不是為整個值配置單一字串。This method reads a small number of characters at a time instead of allocating a single string for the whole value. - 依預設不會展開一般實體。By default general entities are not expanded. 當呼叫 方法時，會展開一般實體。General entities are expanded when you call the method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 這個建構函式會將指定的字串剖析為 XML 片段。This constructor parses the given string as a fragment of XML. 如果元素或屬性的 XML 片段，您可以略過的語式正確的 XML 文件根層級的規則。If the XML fragment is an element or attribute, you can bypass the root level rules for well-formed XML documents. 下表列出的有效值`fragType`。The following table lists valid values for `fragType`. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|片段可能包含Fragment May Contain| |-----------------|--------------------------| |`Element`|任何有效的項目內容 （例如，項目、 註解、 處理指示、 CDATA 區段、 文字和實體參考的任何組合）。Any valid element content (for example, any combination of elements, comments, processing instructions, CDATA sections, text, and entity references).

您也可以提供 XML 宣告。An XML declaration can also be supplied. 這可讓您指定的編碼方式的 XML 片段，而不是不必上設定物件。This allows you to specify the encoding for the XML fragment, rather than having to set it on the object.| |`Attribute`|屬性 （在引號內的部分） 的值。The value of an attribute (the part inside the quotes).| |`Document`|完整的 XML 文件內容。The contents of an entire XML document. 這會強制執行文件層級的規則。This enforces document level rules.| 讀取器會使用下列來決定資料流的編碼方式。The reader uses the following to determine the encoding of the stream. 1. 檢查屬性來判斷的編碼方式。Checks the property to determine the encoding. 2. 如果`Encoding`屬性是`null`，讀取器已檢查的資料流開頭的位元組順序標記。If the `Encoding` property is `null`, the reader checks for a byte-order mark at the beginning of the stream. 3. 如果`Encoding`屬性是`null`，並找到沒有位元組順序標記、 讀取器會假設資料流以 utf-8 編碼。If the `Encoding` property is `null`, and no byte-order mark is found, the reader assumes the stream is encoded in UTF-8.

span.span: is not an Element, Attribute, or Document .
is .

## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 這個建構函式會將指定的字串剖析為 XML 片段。This constructor parses the given string as a fragment of XML. 如果元素或屬性的 XML 片段，您可以略過的語式正確的 XML 文件根層級的規則。If the XML fragment is an element or attribute, you can bypass the root level rules for well-formed XML documents. 這個建構函式可以處理從傳回的字串。This constructor can handle strings returned from . 下表列出的有效值`fragType`和如何讀取器會剖析每個不同的節點型別。The following table lists valid values for `fragType` and how the reader parses each of the different node types. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|片段可能包含Fragment May Contain| |-----------------|--------------------------| |元素Element|任何有效的項目內容 （例如，項目、 註解、 處理指示、 CDATA 區段、 文字和實體參考的任何組合）。Any valid element content (for example, any combination of elements, comments, processing instructions, CDATA sections, text, and entity references).

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此屬性可以隨時變更，而且會在下一步的讀取作業上生效。This property can be changed at any time and takes effect on the next read operation. > [!NOTE] > 如果用來建構，若要將屬性值正常化`Normalization`必須設為`true`。If the is used to construct an , to normalize attribute values, `Normalization` must be set to `true`. 如果`Normalization`設`false`，這也會停用檢查數值實體的字元範圍。If `Normalization` is set to `false`, this also disables character range checking for numeric entities. 如此一來，字元實體，例如`�`，允許。As a result, character entities, such as `�`, are allowed. 以下描述屬性值正常化：The following describes attribute value normalization: - 對於字元參考，請將參考的字元附加到屬性值中。For a character reference, append the referenced character to the attribute value. - 對於實體參考，請以遞迴處理實體的取代文字。For an entity reference, recursively process the replacement text of the entity. - 空格字元 （#x、 #xD、 #xA、 #x），將 #x 附加至正規化值。For a white space character (#x20, #xD, #xA, #x9), append #x20 to the normalized value. （只有單一 #x 附加為外部剖析實體的一部分或內部剖析實體的常值的實體值"#xD #xA"順序）。(Only a single #x20 is appended for a "#xD#xA" sequence that is part of an external parsed entity or the literal entity value of an internal parsed entity.) - 處理其他字元，請將它們附加至正規化值中。Process other characters by appending them to the normalized value. - 如果宣告的值不是 CDATA，捨棄任何開頭和尾端的空格 (#x) 字元和空格 (# #x) 字元的序列取代為單一空白字元 (# #x)。If the declared value is not CDATA, discard any leading and trailing space (#x20) characters and replace sequences of space (#x20) characters with a single space (#x20) character. `XmlTextReader`只會執行屬性或 CDATA 正規化。The `XmlTextReader` only performs attribute or CDATA normalization. 它不會執行特定的 DTD 正規化，除非包裝內`XmlValidatingReader`。It does not do DTD-specific normalization unless wrapped within an `XmlValidatingReader`. 請參閱 W3C XML 1.0 recommendation 的進一步討論正規化。Refer to the W3C XML 1.0 recommendation for further discussion on normalization. ## Examples 下列範例會顯示讀取器行為正規化為開啟，然後關閉。The following example shows reader behavior with normalization turned on and then off. [!code-cpp[XmlTextReader.Normalization#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.Normalization/CPP/readnormal.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlTextReader.Normalization#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.Normalization/CS/readnormal.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlTextReader.Normalization#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.Normalization/VB/readnormal.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. DTD 處理預設會啟用為回溯相容性。DTD processing is enabled by default for backwards compatibility. 不過，除非您的應用程式需要 DTD 處理，您應該停用此設定。However, unless your application requires DTD processing, you should disable this setting. 在防止某些阻斷服務攻擊時，停用 DTD 處理會很有用。Disabling DTD processing can be useful in preventing certain denial of service attacks. 如果設定為`true`，讀取器會擲回時遇到任何 DTD 內容。If set to `true`, the reader throws an when any DTD content is encountered. 如果您已啟用 DTD 處理，您需要注意的 dtd 從受信任的來源和可能的阻絕服務攻擊。If you have DTD processing enabled, you need to be aware of including DTDs from untrusted sources and possible denial of service attacks. 使用，限制的資源，可以存取。Use the to restrict the resources that the can access. 您還可以設計應用程式，讓 XML 處理具有記憶體和時間限制。You can also design your application so that the XML processing is memory and time constrained. 例如，ASP.NET 應用程式中設定逾時限制For example, configure time-out limits in your ASP.NET application

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 當讀取器第一次建立並初始化時，沒有任何可用資訊。When a reader is first created and initialized, there is no information available. 您必須呼叫`Read`讀取的第一個節點。You must call `Read` to read the first node. 這個方法需要從資料流至少四個位元組，才能開始剖析。This method requires at least four bytes from the data stream in order to begin parsing. 如果傳回少於四個位元組資料流中沒有詳細資料，該方法會失敗。If fewer than four bytes are returned and there is no more data in the stream, the method will fail. 如果資料流中有更多資料，方法會封鎖直到接收第四個位元組的剖析。If there is more data in the stream, the method will block parsing until receipt of the fourth byte. ## Examples 下列範例會讀取 XML 檔案，並顯示每個節點。The following example reads an XML file and displays each node. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 這是最有效率的方式可以處理非常大的資料流的 XML 文件中的內嵌文字。This is the most efficient way to process very large streams of text embedded in an XML document. 而不是配置大型的字串物件`ReadChars`一次將緩衝區傳回的文字內容。Rather than allocating large string objects, `ReadChars` returns text content a buffer at a time. 這個方法被為了只能用於元素節點。This method is designed to work only on element nodes. 其他節點類型都會造成`ReadChars`傳回`0`。Other node types cause `ReadChars` to return `0`. 在下列 XML 中，如果讀取器位於開始標記、`ReadChars`傳回`test`，並將讀取器置於結束標記的後面。In the following XML, if the reader is positioned on the start tag, `ReadChars` returns `test` and positions the reader after the end tag. ```xml test ``` `ReadChars` 具有下列功能：`ReadChars` has the following functionality: - 這個方法被為了在只有項目節點上運作。This method is designed to work on element nodes only. 其他節點類型都會造成`ReadChars`傳回 0。Other node types cause `ReadChars` to return 0. - 這個方法會傳回實際的字元內容。This method returns the actual character content. 不會解析實體、 CDATA 或發生的任何其他標記。There is no attempt to resolve entities, CDATA, or any other markup encountered. `ReadChars` 傳回的所有項目開始標記與結束標記，包括標記之間。`ReadChars` returns everything between the start tag and the end tag, including markup. - `ReadChars` 會忽略格式不正確的 XML 標記。`ReadChars` ignores XML markup that is not well-formed. 例如，當讀取下列 XML 字串`12`，`ReadChars`傳回`12`。For example, when reading the following XML string `12`, `ReadChars` returns `12`. （它傳回的相符項目組標記，並忽略其他人。）(It returns markup from the matching element pair and ignores others.) - 這個方法不會進行任何正規化。This method does not do any normalization. - 當`ReadChars`已達結束的字元資料流中，它會傳回值 0 和讀取器定位於結束標記的後面。When `ReadChars` has reached the end of the character stream, it returns the value 0 and the reader is positioned after the end tag. - 讀取屬性的方法是不使用時`ReadChars`。Attribute read methods are not available while using `ReadChars`. 例如，使用下列 XML:For example, using the following XML: ```xml some text ``` 讀取器位於``項目結尾的 while 迴圈。The reader is positioned on the `` element at the end of the while loop. ```csharp if (XmlNodeType.Element == reader.NodeType && "thing" == reader.Name) { while(0 != reader.ReadChars(buffer, 0, 1) { // Do something. // Attribute values are not available at this point. } } ``` ## Examples 下列範例中使用 XML 讀取`ReadChars`。The following example reads in XML using `ReadChars`. [!code-cpp[Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example/VB/source.vb#1)] 該範例使用 `items.xml` 檔案做為輸入。The example uses the `items.xml` file as input. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 這個方法內容串流、 解碼`Base64`內容，並傳回解碼的二進位位元組 (例如，內嵌`Base64`-編碼的 GIF 影像) 到緩衝區。This method streams the content, decodes the `Base64` content, and returns the decoded binary bytes (for example, an inline `Base64`-encoded GIF image) into the buffer. 這個方法可以連續呼叫來讀取內嵌文字的大量資料流。This method can be called successively to read large streams of embedded text. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 RFC 1521"MIME （多用途網際網路郵件延伸標準） 部分一個： 機制來指定，並描述網際網路訊息內文的格式 」。For more information, see RFC 1521, "MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) Part One: Mechanisms for Specifying and Describing the Format of Internet Message Bodies". 您可以取得從 Rfc[註解的網站要求](https://www.rfc-editor.org)。You can obtain RFCs from the [Request for Comments Web site](https://www.rfc-editor.org). > [!NOTE] > 您不應該存取的任何呼叫之間的讀取器屬性方法，直到該方法會傳回值為 0。You should not access any of the reader properties between calls to the method until the method returns the value 0. 此方法具有下列行為：This method has the following behavior: - 當它到達它所操作的位元組資料流結尾傳回 0 的值。 returns the value 0 when it has reached the end of the byte stream it was operating on. 讀取器第一個非內容節點上。The reader is positioned on the first non-content node. - 如果您尋求更少，或的確實數目，也會保留在資料流讀取位元組會保留在其目前位置。If you ask for fewer, or the exact number, of bytes than are left in the stream the reader remains in its current position. - 不支援下列的 XML 節點類型： `Element`， `XmlDeclaration`， `None`， `Document`， `DocumentType`， `Notation`， `Entity`， `DocumentFragment`。 is not supported on the following XML node types: `Element`, `XmlDeclaration`, `None`, `Document`, `DocumentType`, `Notation`, `Entity`, `DocumentFragment`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 這個方法讀取的項目內容中，使用 Base64 編碼方式，將其解碼，並傳回已解碼的二進位位元組 （例如，內嵌 Base64 編碼的 GIF 影像） 到緩衝區。This method reads the element content, decodes it using Base64 encoding, and returns the decoded binary bytes (for example, an inline Base64 encoded GIF image) into the buffer. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 RFC 1521"MIME （多用途網際網路郵件延伸標準） 部分一個： 機制來指定，並描述網際網路訊息內文的格式 」。For more information, see RFC 1521, "MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) Part One: Mechanisms for Specifying and Describing the Format of Internet Message Bodies". 您可以取得從 Rfc[註解的網站要求](https://www.rfc-editor.org)。You can obtain RFCs from the [Request for Comments Web site](https://www.rfc-editor.org). 這個方法只能讀取簡單內容項目。This method can only read simple-content elements. 項目可以包含文字、 泛空白字元、 顯著泛空白字元、 CDATA 區段中，註解和處理指示。The element can contain text, white space, significant white space, CDATA sections, comments and processing instructions. 它也可以包含實體參考，會自動展開。It can also contain entity references, which are automatically expanded. 項目不能有子項目。The element cannot have child elements. 這個方法是非常類似於元素節點型別上只能呼叫只是它的方法。This method is very similar to the method except that it can only be called on element node types. 如果`count`值高於在文件中的位元組數目，或如果是，文件中的位元組數目等於讀取文件中所有剩餘的位元組，並傳回讀取的位元組數目。If the `count` value is higher than the number of bytes in the document, or if it is equal to the number of bytes in the document, the reads all the remaining bytes in the document and returns the number of bytes read. 下一步方法呼叫會傳回零，並將讀取器移至節點下。The next method call returns a zero and moves the reader to the node following the . 如果您呼叫已耗用所有的項目內容之前，讀取器可能如同所耗用的第一個內容，然後呼叫方法。If you call before all of the element content is consumed, the reader may behave as if the first content was consumed and then the method was called. 這表示讀取器讀取的所有文字，直到遇到結束項目。This means that the reader reads all the text until the end element is encountered. 然後讀取結束標記節點，讀取的下一個節點，並再將本身置於下一步的後續節點。It then reads the end tag node, reads the next node, and then positions itself on the next subsequent node. ## Examples 請參閱若要查看使用這個方法的範例。See to see an example using this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 如果位於項目，`ReadString`串連所有文字、 顯著泛空白字元，泛空白字元和`CData`區段節點型別一起，並傳回串連的項目內容資料。If positioned on an element, `ReadString` concatenates all text, significant white space, white space, and `CData` section node types together and returns the concatenated data as the element content. 它會停止時遇到任何標記，包括註解和處理指示。It stops when any markup is encountered, including comments and processing instructions. 這可能會發生於混合內容模型中，或是讀取項目結束標記時。This could occur in a mixed content model, or when an element end tag is read. 如果文字節點上，位於`ReadString`執行相同的串連文字節點從至指定的項目結束標記。If positioned on a text node, `ReadString` performs the same concatenation from the text node to the element end tag. 如果讀取器定位於屬性文字節點上，則 `ReadString` 具有相同的功能，就像讀取器定位於項目開始標記上一樣。If the reader is positioned on an attribute text node, `ReadString` has the same functionality as if the reader were position on the element start tag. 它會傳回所有串連的項目文字節點。It returns all the concatenated element text nodes. ## Examples 下列範例會顯示每個項目的文字內容。The following example displays the text content of each element. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 這個屬性代表`xml:lang`內目前的節點所在的範圍。This property represents the `xml:lang` scope within which the current node resides. 例如，以下是使用 XML 片段`xml:lang`根項目設定為 英文 （美國）：For example, here is an XML fragment with `xml:lang` set to US English in the root element: \<根 xml: lang ="en-我們">\ \<名稱 > Fred \< /名稱 >\Fred\ \\ 當讀取器位於`name`項目，您可以使用這個屬性來尋找它位於範圍內的美式英文`xml:lang`屬性。When the reader is positioned on the `name` element, you can use this property to find that it is in the scope of a US English `xml:lang` attribute. ## Examples 下列範例會顯示`xml:lang`每個節點的值。The following example displays the `xml:lang` value for each of the nodes. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 從.NET Framework 2.0 開始，我們建議您先建立所使用的執行個體方法，以充分利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 讀取器會使用`XmlResolver`解析此位置的檔案讀取器會載入並解析 DTD 參考。The reader uses `XmlResolver` to resolve the location of the file loaded into the reader and also to resolve DTD references. 例如，如果您的 XML 包含 DOCTYPE 宣告中，``讀取器會解析外部檔案，並確保 DTD 的格式是否正確。For example, if your XML included the DOCTYPE declaration, `` the reader resolves this external file and ensures that the DTD is well-formed. 讀取器不會使用 DTD 驗證。The reader does not use the DTD for validation. 此屬性可以隨時變更，而且會在下一步的讀取作業上生效。This property can be changed at any time and takes effect on the next read operation. 如果這個屬性設定為`null`，讀取器所遇到的任何外部 DTD 參考無法解析。If this property is set to `null`, any external DTD references encountered by the reader are not resolved. 1.1 版中[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]，如果未設定這個屬性，應用程式的信任層級決定的預設行為。In version 1.1 of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)], if this property is not set, the trust level of the application determines the default behavior. `Fully trusted code:` 讀取器會使用預設值不具使用者認證。`Fully trusted code:` The reader uses a default with no user credentials. 如果驗證才能存取網路資源，使用`XmlResolver`屬性來指定`XmlResolver`具有必要認證。If authentication is required to access a network resource, use the `XmlResolver` property to specify an `XmlResolver` with the necessary credentials. `Semi-trusted code:` `XmlResolver`屬性設定為`null`。`Semi-trusted code:` The `XmlResolver` property is set to `null`. 不會解析外部資源。External resources are not resolved. ## Examples 下列範例會使用`XmlResolver`屬性來指定存取網路上的檔案所需的認證。The following example uses the `XmlResolver` property to specify the credentials necessary to access the networked file. [!code-cpp[XmlTextReader.XmlResolver#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.XmlResolver/CPP/rdr_resolver.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlTextReader.XmlResolver#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.XmlResolver/CS/rdr_resolver.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlTextReader.XmlResolver#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.XmlResolver/VB/rdr_resolver.vb#1)]
